meanings.definition: Of or relating to a peduncle.
meanings.sent1: The peduncular stem supported the beautiful flower.
meanings.sent2: The peduncular attachment was strong and secure.
meanings.sent3: The peduncular shape of the tree branch made it look like a natural hook.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back in a peduncular manner, resembling a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The peduncular design of the lamp post made it stand out in the park.

meanings.sent1: The peduncular fruit hung low on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The peduncular growth was noticeable on the plant.
meanings.sent3: The peduncular appearance of the mushroom made it seem like a tiny umbrella.
meanings.sent4: The peduncular shape of the pendant resembled a delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The peduncular structure of the building added an interesting touch to the architecture.

meanings.sent1: The peduncular shape of the cloud stretched across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The peduncular pattern on the fabric was unique.
meanings.sent3: The peduncular swirls in the painting gave it a whimsical touch.
meanings.sent4: The peduncular curve of the road led us through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The peduncular design of the vase made it look like a blooming flower.
